subject: Sales
title: Color Psychology in Selling
description: A quick, practical guide to Color Psychology in Selling.

hook.text: Facebook is blue. McDonald's is red and yellow. Tiffany's is robin egg blue. None of this is random.

buildup.text: Color psychology studies how hues affect mood, behavior, and purchasing decisions unconsciously.

discovery.text: Red creates urgency. Blue builds trust. Green signals health. Orange drives action. Each color speaks.

twist.text: The impact is cultural. White means purity in the West but mourning in parts of Asia. Context matters.

climax.text: Choose brand colors intentionally. The right palette makes buyers feel what you want before they read a word.

punchline.text: The right color sells before a single word is read.

quiz.question: Why is color choice important in branding?
options: Colors unconsciously affect mood and purchasing behavior
